hook.text: In 1922, a ten-minute radio ad sold apartments in New York. Advertising found its voice â€” literally.

buildup.text: Radio reached millions at once. For the first time, one seller could pitch to an entire nation.

discovery.text: Jingles, catchy slogans, and sponsored programs turned unknown brands into household names overnight.

twist.text: Radio also meant audiences couldn't skip the ad. The ongoing battle for attention had officially begun.

climax.text: Radio proved that the medium shapes the message. Audio storytelling became a permanent sales channel.

punchline.text: Radio gave advertising its voice and its reach.

quiz.question: What made radio revolutionary for selling?
options: It could reach millions simultaneously with audio pitches
